tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE water_samples (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    pollutant_name VARCHAR(255),
    pollutant_level FLOAT,
    collection_date DATE,
    source_id INT
);

CREATE TABLE location_details (
    location_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location_name VARCHAR(255),
    latitude DECIMAL(10, 8),
    longitude DECIMAL(11, 8)
);}]}  Also, please note that for simplicity's sake, I will generate the tables without foreign key constraints for now. Feel free to add those as needed.  Let me know if you'd like me to include them.  The theme of the database is

CREATE TABLE WaterSamples (
    sample_id INT,
    source_id INT,
    date_collected DATE,
    pH FLOAT,
    salinity FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE PollutionSources (
    source_id INT,
    source_name VARCHAR(50),
    location VARCHAR(100),
    pollution_level FLOAT,
    description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE ChemicalComposition (
    composition_id INT,
    sample_id INT,
    chemical_name VARCHAR(50),
    concentration FLOAT,
    units VARCHAR(20)
);

CREATE TABLE WaterSamples (
  sample_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  source_name TEXT,
  sample_date DATE,
  pH FLOAT,
  salinity FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE PollutionSources (
  source_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  source_name TEXT,
  location TEXT,
  pollution_type TEXT,
  pollution_level FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE ChemicalAnalysis (
  analysis_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  sample_id INT,
  chemical_name TEXT,
  concentration FLOAT,
  FOREIGN KEY (sample_id) REFERENCES WaterSamples(sample_id)
);

CREATE TABLE SamplingLocations (
  location_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  location_name TEXT,
  latitude FLOAT,
  longitude FLOAT,
  depth FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE ResearchScientists (
  scientist_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  scientist_name TEXT,
  email TEXT,
  specialization TEXT,
  experience_years INT
);
